data.title: Best Hot Dog in Allentown
data.text:
I'm having a late dinner tonight, so I was thinking of grabbing a quick snack. I was on my way to the Wawa on 15th St. when the open sign at Willie Joe's caught the corner of my eye. I circled the block, parked in front and went down into Willie Joe's. 

I wasn't looking for a full meal, so I ordered one dog with everything. If you're from around here, you know that that means mustard, chopped onions and chili sauce. The total cost with tax was $1.51. The dog was perfect. 

This is the original location of Willie Joe's. It's below street level, so you have to walk down five or six steps to get in. It isn't handicapped accessible. There is no where to sit. This is just a counter where you order food to go. I just ate in the customer area because there wasn't anyone else there. 

If you're not in the mood for the hotdog, and you can't decide between a hamburger or a steak sandwich, consider the "Steak On Burger". It's a hamburger with steak sandwich meat on top. Pretty awesome.

data.title: Great Hot Dogs
data.text: One of my favorite places to go for hot dogs. The chili dogs are awesome! The pirogies are always great. It doesn't look like much from the outside, or inside, for that matter, but the food is great.

data.title: Great hotdogs!!
data.text: I've lived in the Lehigh Valley my entire life and have never tried Willy Joe's until today!  Wow, I have been missing some darn good hotdogs!  In my opinion they are better than Yocco's or Pott's!  We ate the Lehigh St location, and while yes the restaurant may be "outdated" I personally think the atmosphere fits them and how long they have been in business and I wouldn't change a thing!

data.title: Best hot dogs in the valley
data.text: Way better the Yoccos. They serve BERKS hot dogs which in my opinion are the best. Kinda an older building which needs some updating. You can get beer which is always a plus when eating hot dogs. Very good place for a quick lunch.

data.title: Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives Candidate
data.text: Love to check out places that are a little different, and as my son and I both like hot-dogs, to Willy Joe's we went.  Not as easy as it seems as the 15th St location was closed, so went to Lehigh St instead.  Ordered the $1.37 hot-dog with their special chili sauce on top,  They were great.  Only complaint is that there was a kind of funky odor to the place, not terrible but not fragrant either.  If you like cheap eats check it out.

data.title: Great dogs, the original, go to the Lehigh St location
data.text: This is the place for dogs in Allentown, great price, always quality, staff is great, very relaxed environment.  There are other's in Allentown that are good for dogs but this place excels.  Go to the Lehigh St location for the best experience.  Try the pierogies, the best, just add salt.  Steaks are also very good.  Love this place

data.title: great hot dogs
data.text: go there whenever I am in town for hot dogs which are great.  Never ate anything else there. But they serve birch beer which goes great with the dogs.
